name: Northern Greens Resort

reviews.text: after the rave reviews, i was expecting something extraordinary. i thought i had pulled up to the wrong place. i suppose for small town saskatchewan, it is nicer than many, but compared to true 'resorts'' i have stayed at, this is hardly in the same league at all.
reviews.title: resort? is being across the street from a golf course a resort?

reviews.text: i had wondered why anyone would complain about no microwqve but now i know why. going across the street for a 2nd class meal at 'gienies' just didnt cut it for me. the golf course is lovely for htose who golf but there is nothing for others.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!

reviews.text: it is a nice enough motel, the same as any chain hotels on the transcanada, complete with the cold cereal and make your own waffles with canned cool whip to spray on! but resort, i think not!
reviews.title: A Northern Gem

reviews.text: This hotel was perfect except for 1 thing: No microwave in my room.
reviews.title: Elegant Hotel on Golf Course

likes.liked: — The rooms are more comfortable than my own at home.
likes.disliked: — That there aren't more of them around Saskatchewan.

reviews.text: I stayed one night here, and when I first entered my room, I thought it looked very dated. But the bed was very comfortable, everything was very clean, and quiet. There is a beautiful outdoor terrace with a gazebo which is lovely. The breakfast was ok, quite a line up for the waffle maker, but it had something for everybody.
reviews.title: quiet and clean

reviews.text: Nice hotel, clean and comfortable rooms, good assortment of food for a continental breakfast. I would highly recommend the restaurant @ the Evergreen Center. You can unload and ride your sled right from the hotel parking lot! The only downfall was that the outdoor hot tub was out of order. Hopefully it's working when go back for one last ride!
reviews.title: Good place to stay for snowmobiling

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at the Northern Greens Resort in October. It is conveniently located next to the Evergreen Centre which is the location of the curling rink and golf course. There is an very good restaurant at the Evergreen and the hotel offers a convenient complimentary breakfast.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: The rooms are clean and bright and the hotel offers a small fitness centre and a nice outdoor hot tub courtyard.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was very friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate to stay again at this clean, well kept, modern hotel!
reviews.title: Wonderful

description: Newly built in 2001, the resort offers 42 rooms, modern conference facilities, specialty catering, and complimentary internet services. Enjoy the daily breakfast, fitness centre and spa services.
